meanings.definition: The act of limiting or restricting something.
meanings.sent1: The circumscriptions placed on the project hindered its progress.
meanings.sent2: The circumscriptions of the law must be followed by all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The circumscriptions on dessert intake made the party a bit less sweet.
meanings.sent4: Her circumscriptions on screen time were as strict as a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The circumscriptions on the playground equipment kept the children safe.

meanings.definition: The boundaries or limits of an area or activity.
meanings.sent1: The circumscriptions of the park were clearly marked with signs.
meanings.sent2: We must respect the circumscriptions of personal space.
meanings.sent3: The circumscriptions of the game were so tight, it felt like a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The circumscriptions of the ocean seemed endless from the shore.
meanings.sent5: The circumscriptions of the forest were explored by the adventurous hikers.
